author: Sanket Pednekar
text: 'Nice place to have Ramen. I am not that fond of Japanese cuisine but Muteki Ramen has made rethink that. We ordered Bang Ban Shrimp which was pretty good. Maybe they could serve with more dipping sauce as the appetizer do not have much of a spice. We also ordered Karaage Ramen with thin noodles. The quantity was way too much. I felt the chicken was never going to end. The usual ramen taste
column5: nothing extra ordinary but the chicken had good taste. We ended our meal with Mango Mochi Ice cream. It was good too although it was my first time having a mochi icecream. Overall
column6: a decent experience with good food.'

author: TheGrassGuy
text: 'I greatly enjoyed their spicy ramen
column5: and their okonomiyaki too! My first time trying the latter
column6: actually. Liked it.'

author: Bianca Johnson
text: "Went here for lunch with a friend today. The fried chicken boa was soggy and the ramen was not enjoyable from the broth to the thin noodles used nothing was enjoyable didn't eat much at all. My friend got the kimchi ramen and also said hers lacked flavor. There's way better ramen out there"

author: Maria Loera
text: 'We ordered the ramen
column5: okonomiyaki
column6: unagi don
column7: and karaage fried chicken. All items were very tasty and even for delivery you could tell they cared about presentation. I will definitely be ordering from them again if I want a Ramen night in.'

author: John Griffin
text: 'Love the volcano. Always fast. Food is excellent. Thank you.'

author: Daniel Feyjoo
text: "Great food 2nd time there doesn't disappoint"

author: stacey li
text: 'Great place if you are looking for ramen or wanting to experience japanese food. The gyoza was crispy and juicy
column5: the takoyaki was soft and sweet especially since there were bonito on top. We came here with friends
column6: and we all ordered ramen. We had the tonkatsu ramen and karaage ramen
column7: the karaage was so crispy and the crunch was great when you take a bite. And the broth for both ramens were good because you can taste the pork broth in them and it wasnt too salty. Overall
column8: great place and the servers were so nice plus they came back and checked to see if we needed anything. 5 stars and we will be coming back to try other items.'

author: Mar'Keith AllenCampbell
text: 'So after being stationed in Japan for 2 plus years. You get the taste of ramen and udon. Most of the restaurants or shops that sell ramen and udon have a feeling to them that is hard to recreate. So when I walked in
column5: got that warm polite welcome from the staff. A nostalgic feeling hit me
column6: I knew this was gonna be good. The waiter I had was not only polite but patient and kind. So I decided to order the Volcano Miso
column8: and a Ramune Strawberry. The Karaage buns were so soft
column10: and delicious it was like OMG. Volcano Miso hit the spot like a train hitting its destination on a clear beautiful day. Just the right amount of spicy to compliment the oh so butter melt on your tongue pork. All and All if your near this part of jesery this spot you might wanna stop by and try for yourself.'

author: kovit nisar
text: 'Love the veggie ramen and tempura bao'

author: Bryan Cabo
text: 'After a long day with my veteran group and running the flag throughout Northern NJ
column5: we found our way here. I’m always down for ramen but damn i didn’t know i was going to be in for an amazing surprise! Long story short: veggie ramen is phenomenal!!! Also picked up mochi and green tea cheesecake.'

author: Liza Gomelski
text: 'Thank you Muteki for making such a delicious Tamtamen ramen
column5: it makes me happy every time. Excellent service. Not a fancy restaurant for dates but if your craving some hot soup it will fulfill the needs. Will be coming back!'

author: Natasha Brennan
text: 'Food was good
column5: but halfway through I guess the employees children walked out of the kitchen area with a poodle… left the restaurant and shortly came back with the poodle in their arms…. Couldn’t finish my food and was repulsed. When I arrived there was a guest with her pet outside
column6: so if guests have to sit outside with pets WHY would the employees think it’s ok to have pets inside the dining/food prep area. GROSS.'

author: Toni B
text: "We reaally wanted to like this place
column5: but several negatives: 1. While the Volcano ramen was decent
column6: it's definitely on the sweeter side. 2. The ramen with garlic oil (which I always get in ramen places in NJ
column8: and in Asia) tasted like it was all salt. 3. Takoyaki was ridiculous--each one was ALL dough and one tiny piece of squid. When we kindly shared our feedback with the server--he said the takoyakis are made my their supplier so it's not up to them. Ugggghh. Then get a better supplier for food that's worth the money? Which brings me to 4. Overpriced. Even at NYC standards
column10: better tasting bowl for their prices."

author: Tae Kim
text: "It's pretty good for a local ramen restaurant."

author: Michael Hsu
text: "Really enjoy muteki ramen. One of our favorite restaurants in the hoboken/jc area. We got their chicken wing and edamame appetizers which were super flavorful. Can't go wrong with the muteki ramen or tonkotsu"

author: Eric Shwartsman
text: 'Delicious'

author: R K
text: "It is not what Japanese cuisine indeed; base
column5: texture
column6: and bun. I think they don't know how to make genuine Japanese ramen. They should learn it from the bottom."

author: Brooklyn Williamsburg
text: "This place not authentic Japanese ramen. I had tonkotsu ramen but it tasty like pork broth and mixed chicken broth i think. Also
column5: they are NOT Japanese even they can't pronounce of Tonkotsu. If you mad for ramen
column6: don't go here. People go here reason only for location. Horrible Ramen EVER!"

author: Stanley Chan
text: "The ramen was a bit salty for me. Overall I think it's a good deal for ramen in the Hoboken area."

author: Linnea “Adurnari” Stew
text: "Aesthetics: excellent.\n\nService: quick
column5: polite and friendly.\n\nMusic: a hair louder than I would normally like
column6: but great selection nonetheless.\n\nFood: I have chosen
column8: to keep this brief. I could wax eloquent about the quality and flavor
column9: but let's keep it simple. The combination of flavors
column11: and presentation made this my favorite ramen experience ever. I bought one of their souvenir pairs of chopsticks to commemorate the occasion."

author: rana kingi
text: 'Love this place.'

author: Shatilah Perry
text:
'Visited a few weeks ago with my husband.
The atmosphere was nice.
I recommend the tempura buns. They were delicious. The chicken katsu curry don was good. Could’ve been a bit hotter.
Overall
column5: We enjoyed our meal and will visit again.\nFinding parking in Hoboken is terrible. Recommend going earlier in the day.'

author: Amir Zeenreich
text: 'Excellent ramen (ate the miso and vegetarian) and great buns (had the chicken)'

author: Ambrosio Valencia-Romero
text: 'Magnificent!'

author: Dominique Bession
text: 'Very good food
column5: friendly staff.'

author: Justin Lewis
text: 'not authentic taste'

author: Chanell Newton
text: 'Perfect Traditional Japanese ramen shop.🤤🤤.'

author: Kalauna
text: 'The ramen was ok (very heavy on not that great). To be fair
column5: we should’ve know since there was no ones in there. They are nice and get attentive but the food is just lacking. The ramen was $17 ( I got the Volcano miso one) and it was not hot ( i do have a high spice tolerance but even my friends with a lower one said the same) and it was not flavorful. The broth is missing some love and seasoning. I plan to take my leftovers put them on the stove and add some garlic salt and extra seasoning. I also got the buns ( the beef ones) the beef was seasoned well... kinda fatty but a problem but the buns are like warm and ehh. Overall
column6: I would not come back but I don’t feel terrible about the experience.'

author: Christy Tseng
text: 'Nice ramen!!! The buns also taste good'

author: Sheila Serrano
text: 'The food here is delicious. I got the muteki ramen bowl. And a side of wings. The broth was perfect. The beef was delicious. Everything tied so well together. 10/10 recommend.'

author: Bailey Mariner
text: 'I’m so happy to have Muteki Ramen in Hoboken!! Very very tasty
column5: authentic ramen and super kind staff when we dined in. We usually get the black tonkotsu and spicy tonkotsu ramen everytime- always perfect
column6: never any issues with pick up or delivery. The pork pan fried gyoza are the best in the area

author: Ryan Xiao
text: 'I have been their regular customer since they opened ，The food is always fresh and delicious
column5: The volcano ramen is my favorite
column6: I definitely recommend this place…'

author: Aleksandar Basic
text: 'Delicious ramen!'

author: Mary
text: 'We have tried Tantanmen
column5: Muteki
column6: Volcano Miso and Pan-Fried Gyoza. Everything was great!!!!! Also their service!!!'

author: William Winters
text: "Warning: please do not order delivery from this shop.\nI ordered port katsu curry
column5: didn't give me curry; also ordered eel don
column6: rice went bad the next day. Not to mention that all of their vegetables tastes sour
column7: I had runs that day and am still not feeling well.\nNot sure how they could have >4 rating on Google
column8: I suppose they are only bad to deliveries since you can't tip the waiters who put appetizers in boxes. In a word

author: José D. Sanabria Sinuco
text: 'Excellent service
column5: food delicious and waitress speek Spanish too.'

author: mel Gonzalez
text: 'Very good top quality Ramen
column5: Musashi style!!'

author: Hiro Hiro
text: 'Nothing special. Not real Japanese ramen tasty.'

author: Emily Ng
text: 'soo delicious and authentic!'

author: J.A. Cruz
text: "I don't typically like ramen but now I do! Thank you for the incredible dish."

author: Werner Contreras
text: "Great food
column5: great service
column6: good prices and a cool vibe.\n\nThe Pork Buns were incredible. Juicy
column7: flavorful and the bun itself was so soft and moist. I would go again just for these.\n\nThe takoyaki was just the right size
column8: also very flavorful.\n\nLastly the Volcano Ramen was pretty hot
column9: but the pain was worth it.\n\nWrap all that goodness around some fantastic service (every one was so nice) and you've got yourself an excellent restaurant."

author: Erwin Lugnasin
text: 'First time to eat authentic ramen in new jersey. Very accommodating staffs and lovely place.'

author: Rachael Lynch
text: 'Got delivery and everything was Awesome!\nKimchi
column5: chicken wings nice crispy
column6: pork buns tasty and curry pork Katsu delicious! Will definitely order again!'

author: megha vasudev
text: 'Amazing gayoza'

author: Irma Luque
text: 'I absolutely love this place
column5: perfect ramen
column6: perfect pork buns
column7: it’s BYOB and the attention is great
column8: so polite and attentive. They always give you a great welcome greeting when you come in.'

author: Prashant Mall
text: 'Amazing Ramen 🍜 and very friendly staff 😄'

author: cristina marin
text: 'Food is very tasty! Still have to try their ramen!'

author: Karen N
text: 'Very average ramen for the price. If you need a noodle hit take the PATH over to NYC and eat your heart out. If you are already at Muteki
column5: then come here only for the buns!'

author: Juan Tovar
text:
'(Translated by Google) Recommended very good food 👍

(Original)
Recomendado la comida muy buena 👍'

author: Ahnaf
text: 'I had the Muteki Ramen dish. The broth full of flavor but not too rich the meat in it nice and tender so solid dish for the price. I had also tried the karaage (fried chicken) and was delicious definitely recommend. Also had the takoyaki and omg nice crisp outside and melts inside. They were all worth the price tag in my opinion.'

author: Dave Hannigan
text: 'Stopped by and had the Volcano Ramen. Broth was super tasty
column5: noodles cooked perfectly and the spice was nice. Also
column6: the Karaage was delicious too.'

author: vallurupalli sivarupesh
text: 'Loved this place... found a good ramen place .. Their bao buns are good....'

author: Luke Vanderberg
text: "My wife and I order from here about once a week. Usually Wednesday
column5: because for some reason we crave ramen on Tuesdays
column6: and they aren't open on Tuesday.\n\nThe Ramen is very tasty.  We usually get a Miso Ramen and a Volcano Miso Ramen.   Occasionally I mix it up and get the Thai curry ramen.   The buns are good too.  The Muteki wings weren't my favorite
column9: you might like them\n\nWorth a trip for sure."

author: amber mazza
text: 'omg if u go here try the tempura buns they were 10/10!! 100% will be going back'

author: edwards meliton
text: 'Good was food and price was reasonable'

author: Parth Desai
text: 'Nice options for ramen and nice intimate setting'

author: Rahul Kamath
text: 'The food was great and the staff was very friendly and careful'

author: Aditi Khatri
text: 'One of the best Ramen places! Love the Miso Ramen here!!!'

author: Florin Suciu
text: 'Great place to have Ramen. Vulcano Ramen was delicious. I highly recommend it!'

author: Larisa S.
text: 'Great place! Food is delicious
column5: place is clean and staff is friendly. Will come back here definitely.'

author: Trixie 1127
text: 'Delicious food
column5: interesting menu
column6: a personable and personalized service. Thank you for the great job!'

author: Ricardo Cortes
text: "Spectacular food
column5: great service. The tonkatsu ramen here is one of the better ones I've had in the area
column6: rich and satisfying with a good balanced flavor from all its components. The pork chashu is tender
column7: flavorful and plentiful. Both the eat-in and takeout options provide a more-than-enough portion of food. All the accoutrements are provided in generous
column8: balanced amounts to round out the dish. I've been here several times and will return several more."

author: Kayla Talbot
text: 'This place is AMAZING. By far the best ramen place I have ever been to and I’m a bit of a ramen fiend. My favorite items on the menu are the Pork Buns (😍) and the Volcano Miso Ramen (with minced pork)(😍😍😍). 10/10 recommend. The service here is much better than most places in Hoboken if you’re looking for a place to go that’s more personal. You are sure to be full and happy when you finish your meal.'

author: John Cardin
text: 'Kimchi Ramen is my favorite!'

author: Dana Salvatore
text: 'Omg everything was FANTASTIC. best ramen in Hoboken by far!!!! I got the tan tan ramen with egg
column5: pork
column6: and corn. So yummy'

author: Austin Inhulsen
text: 'Spicy tonkotsu 🖐⭐️\nTempura buns 🖐⭐️\nLove this place'

author: Catherine Curtis
text: 'I pretty much order from here bi-weekly. I’ve tried I think 5 of their ramens and they are all full of flavor. I really like their spicy tonkotsu ramen with extra pork and wavy noodles.'

author: Hafsa Aydın
text: 'The food is great
column5: definitely recommend. Their staff is very nice as well!!'

author: Chris Walker
text: 'Delivered within 17 minutes and tastes amazing A+'

author: Sophia T
text: 'Decent ramen'

author: Ariel Smith
text: 'Best ramen in Hoboken/JC! We’ve tried all the spots and this place blows them out of the water. Try the bao buns too
column5: they are incredible!'

author: Derick Kar chun
text: 'Food are delish . Highly recommended'

author: P Wong
text: 'I am amazed that they finally got this place opened
column5: especially with the ongoing pandemic and dining restrictions. We came here in the summer and ate outdoors
column6: the ramen was epic and was totally worth the long wait for Muteki to open their doors here!!! Recently
column8: and the ramen was just as delicious and good portions!'

author: Mila Krasnoiarova
text:
'(Translated by Google) Muteki ramen 👌🏻 ♥ ️

(Original)
Muteki ramen 👌🏻♥️'

author: Michael Mendoza
text: 'Great food
column5: fast service!!'

author: Hazel
text: 'My new fav place! I order through Uber Eats
column5: and the food is tasty and fresh. I like the Black Garlic and Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen. Apetizers are great and one of my other favorite items is the Lychee Tea and the Karaage Buns. Def a must'

author: Rose Nixon
text: 'Good ramen and very quick service. Sat outdoors but they also had indoor seating available. Would go back again.'

author: Adam Smith
text: 'Good food
column5: good selection on the menu.'

author: Kimone B
text: 'Our New favorite Ramen spot! Meat is Delicious Ramen is fresh and always hot. Super filling and great service!! Love it here'

author: Fatmata Camara
text: 'The service was excellent. Ramen was absolutely delicious and the place is pretty affordable.'

author: Mia
text: "Went here for a little birthday dinner and it was so good
column5: I would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to try this ramen and even if it's not your thing they have other options. Not too pricey and it will fill you up. Also the atmosphere is incredible
column6: my favorite was the smoking ramen bowl at the window

author: Nischal Kota
text: 'Amazing vegetarian raman'

author: Michelle Ross
text: "Finally got a chance to try Muteki after waiting for it to open!\n\nTheir ramen is by far the best in Hoboken. We ordered a black tonkotsu
column5: which tasted fairly authentic to versions that we've tried in Japan. We also got the Muteki ramen
column6: which was a nice variation on tonkotsu with a bit more body + extra chashu. The broths were flavorful while still being fairly light
column8:
and the toppings were all delicious; melt-in-your-mouth fatty chashu was a particular highlight.

The portions were also huge! It was like getting 1 kaedama for free.

We tried the yuzu honey drink while there and loved it.

Can't wait to go and try other options from the menu!"

author: Nodir Ibragimov
text: 'Loved the kimchi Ramen'

author: Jojo Gian24
text: 'Wow! This has to be the best Ramen in Hoboken! Tried them all. Delivery was quick and easy. Had the Miso Ramen and Tan tan
column5: both amazing!'

author: Aditya Padature
text: 'You definitely wanna try the dishes if you are  tasting Japanese flavors for first time. Appetizers are must try. I loved the flavors Ramen had. Great Ambiance and Service'

author: Rokotoff
text: '5*****/5 The Best RAMEN in HOBOKEN'

author: JOSE BECERRA
text: 'Great food and very attentive personal.'

author: Yunguang Yu
text: 'Nice Raman'

author: Cris
text: 'Scrumptious Ramen and great service'

author: Greg Milani
text: "Great addition to Hoboken!\n\nEver since I've tried Currydon in a specific place in the city
column5: I've been trying everywhere to find a curry that can suffice.\n\nNeedless to say
column6: I've found that spot. The pork curry is amazing
column8: and very savory. Cannot recommend enough!"

author: Shea Thorpe
text: 'Food presentation very nicely done. They were quick to give us our food and beverages. The food was very good. Bathroom and dining area was very clean. I will definitely be coming back. Recommending this place 100%!'

author: Derrick Hwechul Cho (Derrick)
text:
'(Translated by Google) terrible tonkotsu ramen..

(Original)
terrible tonkotsu ramen..'

author: M G
text: "During the pandemic
column5:
we did take out.
Most logically thing to do in a confined area.

The food is absolutely amazing!
The best ramen I've had in a long time.
Flavor is just perfect.
My new favorite is the Shrimp Tempura Buns
column6:
it's to die for.
Ramen is made to perfection.
The to go packaging is on point.

Love it!
Definitely coming back to try other foods in the menu."

author: Jiaren Li
text: 'Best ramen place in Hoboken - I especially like the quality of noodles they served. I was expecting a bit more for the price but that is only because I have amazing ramen in other cities at places way out of the way from bustling city life. This place definitively outclassed all others here in Hoboken. I would order from here again when I crave ramen'

author: H.C. Laughlin
text: "Given the current restrictions put in place
column5:
the seating arrangements aren't terrible. Would not recommend dining in if you have a child as the sidewalks here are on a small incline; drinks easily slide off with little motion.
I'm excited to dine in as the set up inside looks nice. Seems like they have options for single (perfect for introverts) or group dining.

Ramen:
Presentation 👌
Broth is good. Not as rich as other broths I've had before
column6: but still tasty. Pork was well marinated. Was not a fan of the noodles. I might be wrong
column7: but the noodles did not taste freshly made. I wasn't a huge fan. Overall
column8: I'd give it a 3/5 stars.\n\nPork bun - I prefer a more savory flavored pork buns
column9: but they were still delicious with a sweet taste. 3/5 stars\n\nWe also ordered the lychee drink and that was delicious! Definitely worth a try. 5/5 stars"

author: sunghee kim
text: 'Good new ramen joint in hoboken! The rice dishes were good. Hope I can dine in in the single seat oneday soon.'

author: Katsuya K
text:
'(Translated by Google) Come on early.
→ Ramen was slimy and it was a little different from Japanese one. The fried chicken was delicious.

(Original)
早く来い来い。
→ラーメンはぬるくて、日本のものとは少し違ったぁ。から揚げは美味しかった。'

author: Felix Fox
text: 'I admire this place! They provide splendid dishes
column5: they have a rich menu
column6: The chef in that place is very experienced
column7: I enjoy very much eating all their dishes. The dishes are always of high qualtity
column8: the attitude towards the customers  is very good too. I often go to  this restaurant and I not even once was discontended.  I highly recommend it.'
